title: Kenya: Uchumi Shuts Two Uganda Branches
text:
Uchumi Supermarkets has closed two branches in Uganda in its ongoing restructuring. 
Chief executive Julius Kipng'etich said this is aimed at stabilising operations. 
"We have closed down Kabaragala and Matete branches in Uganda as part of the ongoing rationalization of the business in order to stop financial bleeding and get Uchumi Supermarkets back on its feet. All branches that are not performing will be closed down as part of the reorganisation," Kipng'etich said in a statement yesterday. 
Other Uchumi branches in Uganda are located in Gulu, Garden City and Mbale. 
Maua and Syokimau branches in Kenya have also been closed. 
Kipng'etich said closure of non-performing stores will continue until the supermarket stabilises. 
The Uganda closure has seen at least 180 workers sent home. 
The CEO said staff from the affected branches will not be absorbed as remaining branches have the required staff to handle operations. 
Uchumi posted a half-year (2014-15) loss of Sh262.3 million compared to a net profit of Sh106.9 million. Kenya
